summary: This is an email chain from July 26, 2019, discussing the medication regimen for inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It reveals a decision to provide him with a reduced supply of Colace and Milk of Magnesia for self-carry.

persons.name: Chief Psychologist
persons.role: Chief Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center
persons.context: The email is addressed to and references the Chief Psychologist at the MCC regarding the medication for inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Medication Protocol Adjustment for Epstein
events.description: A decision was communicated to provide inmate Jeffrey Epstein with 15 days worth of Colace and a half bottle of milk of magnesia for self-carry, instead of the previously planned 30 days of Colace and a full bottle.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is dated July 26, 2019, which is less than two weeks before Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
It shows prison staff were managing Epstein's medication supply, specifically laxatives (Colace and Milk of Magnesia).
The protocol was adjusted to give Epstein a 15-day self-carry supply instead of a 30-day supply.
The correspondence involves the Chief Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
The document is marked as CONFIDENTIAL and is part of the SDNY evidence collection (SDNY_00009780).
